name: Instant Pot® Salt and Vinegar Boiled Peanuts
author: Soup Loving Nicole
summary: I've made Cajun boiled peanuts many times over the years but was wanting to do something different this time. While trying to come up with something, I looked over and saw a bag of salt and vinegar potato chips and thought... why not? Making boiled peanuts in the Instant Pot® is as easy as 1-2-3. Pour them in and walk away. No more babysitting the pot of boiling water on the stove.
ingredients: 1 pound raw Virginia peanuts in shells
directions: Whisk vinegar, water, and salt in a large bowl
Add peanuts and stir to coat
Transfer mixture to a gallon-sized plastic zip-top bag and let sit for 8 hours or overnight
Pour bag of peanuts and liquid into a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®)
Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 120 minutes
Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build
Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes
